Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)
The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Pat \Pat\, adv. In a pat manner. [1913 Webster]
I foresaw then 't would come in pat hereafter. --Sterne. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Pat \Pat\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Patted}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Patting}.] [Cf. G. patschen, Prov. G. patzen, to strike, tap.] To strike gently with the fingers or hand; to stroke lightly; to tap; as, to pat a dog. [1913 Webster]
Gay pats my shoulder, and you vanish quite. --Pope. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Pat \Pat\, n. 1. A light, quik blow or stroke with the fingers or hand; a tap. [1913 Webster]
2. A small mass, as of butter, shaped by pats. [1913 Webster]
It looked like a tessellated work of pats of butter. --Dickens. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Pat \Pat\, a. [Cf. pat a light blow, D. te pas convenient, pat, where pas is fr. F. passer to pass.] Exactly suitable; fit; convenient; timely. ``Pat allusion.'' --Barrow. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: Virtual Entity of Relevant Acronyms (Version 1.9, June 2002)

Definition.WordDefinition: PAT Port and Address Translation (IOS, Cisco, LAN, IP)

pat adj 1: having only superficial plausibility; "glib promises"; "a slick commercial" [syn: {glib}, {slick}] 2: exactly suited to the occasion; "a pat reply" n 1: the sound made by a gentle blow [syn: {rap}, {tap}] 2: a light touch or stroke [syn: {tap}, {dab}] adv : completely or perfectly; "he has the lesson pat"; "had the system down pat" v 1: pat or squeeze fondly or playfully, especially under the chin [syn: {chuck}] 2: hit lightly; "pat him on the shoulder" [syn: {dab}] [also: {patting}, {patted}]
